intro: Cyanus dentato-folius, commonly known as the Guernsey carnation, is a flowering plant native to the island of Guernsey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright blue or purple flowers with a distinctive central disk. The plant has serrated, toothed leaves that give it its scientific name, and it typically grows in rocky or coastal environments. It is a perennial herb that produces showy blooms from late summer to early autumn. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
